ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Balkan history.

I learned a lot about the history of S.E. Europe and the culture in the region, and got to do through through interesting readings, lectures, and I think most importantly, the excursions and self explorationgetting to interact with others, see the cities and sites, see how life is structured in the various places we went to (e.g. with food, work, city layout, types of stores, everything). It was really engaging and interesting! I also will say, the way the history lectures are structured are so so illuminating! I initially wondered whether all the segments of history would fit together (since we covered so many periods), but they absolutely intertwineit is so so hard to understand even some of the most recent history without really taking in the full picture! So amazing!

The course is an amazing starting place for all this history and getting a cultural framework that enhances this historical learningeach segment has so much deep history to dive into!

Enrolling in this course provided me with a fresh perspective on Southeastern Europe, a region I had limited familiarity with. The class delved into a comprehensive history of the Balkans, spanning from the Illyrians and Ottomans to the Yugoslav Banates to Communist Yugoslavia. The readings were notably intriguing as they dispelled many prevalent misconceptions and myths surrounding the Balkans.

Through this course, I have learned more about the history and culture of Southeastern Europe. I have also gained a better understanding of nationhood, national identity, and the overall political upbringing of the post-Yugoslav region.
Deep understanding of Balkan history and how it informs current events in the area.
History of the Balkans region
I gained so much insight into the extremely complex history of the Balkans. I feel that now I am well versed in the story of the area.
I learned a lot about the history and culture of Southeastern Europe.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Good schedule.

The course was really great in the way it combined historical context with excursions so we could see the history and culture of Croatia and Bosnia as parts of S.E. Europe. It really enhanced what we were learning. And It was so so so cool to get to see some of the many sights and relics that we talked about about in class out in real life (e.g. we saw impacts of Ottoman influence in Bosnia with the mosques and markets, and architecture). And it was soooo cool to get to see influences from all periods (e.g. Roman ruins, seeing Dubrovnik and its Mediterranean state old town and museums, art museums, seeing one of the archives). And I loved the amount of free time we got to explore and do a little bit of historical digging our selves. Was phenomenal, and I liked how the responses were geared towards allowing us to combine and synthesize these two experiences together.

This course's notable strength lies in its immersive nature, allowing for immediate real-world application of learned concepts. The excursions, both relaxing and enlightening, provide valuable insights into local cultures and contribute to a richer understanding. The course effectively exposes students to the vibrant culture and diverse cuisine of Croatia and Bosnia. However, a weakness in the class was that the final paper felt a bit rushed and lacked clear, detailed guidelines. Additionally, I wish we would have spent more time covering the sociology of the course in learning more about the sociological perspective of the region outside of genocide.

The course offered a wide variety of strengths, particularly stemming from the weekly excursions and the instructor! The class learned an incredible amount about Croatia's history, from ancient to modern, by interacting with the region's people and its historical and cultural sites while on these excursions.
I think we could have learned a bit more about Dubrovnik itself.
more opportunities for discussions w the profs rather than lectures
Awesome course! No weaknesses!
Strengths: the instructors are awesome and do a wonderful job of communicating the information in a digestible manner.
This course has no weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you're looking for an enriching and relaxing summer, this program is for you! The lecture schedule is chill, we get the whole afternoon free, and we usually use the afternoon to go to the beach, walk around old city, explore nearby cities, etc. After the program, you can really call yourself a local of Dubrovnik because of the free time. The lectures are also very comprehensive, giving an overall view on the Balkans, while also presenting many details for you to follow up on if u=interested. The excursions are definitely the highlight of the program. We get to go to different islands to experience different food, culture, and see different artifacts, while also having a lot of free time. Definitely one of by best Yale experiences.

Absolutely!!! Amazing course! Allows you to learn and appreciate the developments in S.E. Europe, which are often overlooked but central and important in understanding the region and how various historical players all interacted (e.g. Romans, Byzantines, Hapsbergs, Ragusa, Venice, Ottomans, Communists, Yugoslavia all were in the region and played left influences), and it was sooo soooo amazing to get to see life in S.E. Europe in the present, get to go on excursions that supplemented our knowledge with time to see museums, swim, see life in the region. So so wonderful! And at the same time you have so much time to enjoy Dubrovnik and Bosnia on your own and with friends who are on the trip! Perfect balance of work and exploration and free time!

I would definitely recommend this course to anyone seeking a rewarding and enlightening summer experience in Europe. The professors do a great job explaining the region and exposing you to the culture. It is a great opportunity to explore a lesser-known yet captivating region, fostering a deeper understanding that is both enriching and interesting.
I would recommend this course to anyone interested in studying the history of Southeastern Europe. Croatia's scenic views and beautiful coastline also make the experience well worth it!
Yes!!!! An incredible experience
Yes, taking this course in Dubrovnik was such an awesome experience!
Yes because this course is amazing. You get to experience Europe while learning so much!

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: Remember.

I have not taken too many history classes, but I will say that this course has still changed my perspective on how to approach and understand history and its relationship in culture in really tangible way.

In terms of looking at events, even in modernity, I think this has made me appreciate how I should be more informed about culture and history (especially after reading/seeing how often not doing this can lead people astray).

More personally, I have really enjoyed the region and hope to get to learn even more about it and get to visit again soon! Thank you for such an amazing summer!

While I may not belong to the humanities or social science field, this course has profoundly impressed upon me the significance of stepping beyond my comfort zone and the profound rewards of comprehending and immersing oneself in diverse cultures. Moreover, I've come to realize the importance of delving into the histories of various regions, either to learn from past errors or to appreciate the richness and significance of certain traditions. Consequently, this course has been an intellectually stimulating, socially engaging, and culturally enlightening journey for me.

In the future, I hope to utilize the knowledge and skills gained from this course when traveling to other places abroad. The course truly is an immersive experiences that has prepared me for future independent travel!
Hopefully I will now spend more time in the Balkans!
To better the world!
I am a history major so this knowledge will be applicable to other classes at Yale. Additionally I have a gained a broader view of the Europe and the world as a whole.

extras.title: HIST S299 01 - History of Southeastern Europe
